trustfund:
TF037402-EQUATORIAL GUINEA - HEALTH
            IMPROVEMENT PROJECT,TF020430-AUSTRIAN CONSULTANT TRUST FUND

abstracts.cdata!:
The project rating is highly
            unsatisfactory. Construction and rehabilitation achievements
            of health centers, and of the Ministry of Health (MOH)
            buildings, were successful, yet, these were later found to
            be underutilized, and deteriorating. The project failed in
            strengthening management capacity at central, regional, and
            delivery levels, including in major hospitals. The health
            management information system, never became operational,
            which hindered the health strategy, and decision capacity of
            the MOH. Several key lessons may be drawn from the project:
            1) Upon identification of risks, such as poor management
            capacity, and implementation by the Borrower, adequate
            technical assistance (TA), and institutional support should
            be planned for project implementation. This TA should work
            closely with, and transfer skills to qualified national
            counterparts. 2) Project ownership should be ensured,
            through staff continuity, from the Bank, as from the
            government, to achieve the necessary involvement, as of
            preparation, through full implementation. 3) The lack of
            adequate supervision by Bank staff, prevented addressing
            potential risks, which could have solved project
            difficulties - particularly in a complex case, and a weak
            Borrower capacity. 4) The continued lack of reaction from
            the Bank's management, needs to be addressed as an
            institutional weakness, which severely compromises its credibility.
